sub_topic: The chaotic behavior of the weather system
message_1: A weather station recorded the temperature in a particular city for the last 15 days. The temperatures in degrees Celsius were: 20, 23, 24, 22, 20, 21, 22, 24, 25, 26, 27, 25, 26, 27, 28. Determine the Lyapunov exponent of the system that generated these temperatures.
message_2:
The Lyapunov exponent is a measure used in the study of dynamical systems, particularly in the context of chaos theory. It is used to quantify the rate of separation of infinitesimally close trajectories in a system. However, calculating the Lyapunov exponent requires a mathematical model of the system, which is not provided in this case.

With only a list of temperatures, we cannot determine the Lyapunov exponent of the system that generated these temperatures. We would need more information about the underlying dynamics of the system, such as a set of differential equations or a discrete map that describes how the temperatures evolve over time.
